intro: Calomecon, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Calomecon is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
